categories.name: Security
categories.description: CSP A+ compliance — ensures zero inline code, no external resource dependencies, and no dangerous JavaScript patterns.
categories.why: Content Security Policy (CSP) A+ rating requires strict separation of markup, styles, and scripts. Inline code enables cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. External CDN dependencies create supply-chain risk and single points of failure. Dangerous JS patterns like `eval()` and `document.write()` bypass CSP and enable code injection. This category enforces the OWASP-recommended defense-in-depth strategy.

checks.name: Inline style attributes
checks.description: Scans every line for `style="..."` attributes (violates Content Security Policy). Skips HTML comments.

checks.name: Inline event handlers
checks.description: Detects 40+ inline JS handlers: mouse, keyboard, touch, drag, pointer, clipboard, animation/transition, and misc events. Skips HTML comments.

checks.name: Inline script blocks
checks.description: Finds `<script>` tags without a `src` attribute (inline JS execution). Exempts `type="application/ld+json"` (JSON-LD structured data).

checks.name: External CDN references
checks.description: Catches `href`/`src` pointing to googleapis, cdnjs, unpkg, jsdelivr, cloudflare, etc.

checks.name: External link security
checks.description: Flags `target="_blank"` links missing `rel="noopener noreferrer"`

checks.name: Dangerous JS patterns (app.js)
checks.description: Scans app.js for `eval()`, `new Function()`, `document.write()`, and string args to `setTimeout`/`setInterval`. Skips JS comments.

categories.name: Template Compliance
categories.description: Template compliance — verifies every page has the required structural, SEO, navigation, breadcrumb, and ethics elements.
categories.why: Every page must function as a standalone entry point. Missing meta tags degrade SEO and social sharing. Missing navigation traps users. Missing accessibility infrastructure (skip links, ADL panel) violates WCAG AA. Missing ethics components (ticker, policy links) breach the site's responsible AI commitment. Missing breadcrumbs break wayfinding on interior pages. This category ensures no page ships incomplete.

checks.name: HTML lang attribute
checks.description: Every page must have `<html lang="en">`

checks.name: Meta charset
checks.description: Every page must declare `<meta charset="UTF-8">`

checks.name: Viewport meta tag
checks.description: Every page must have a responsive viewport meta tag

checks.name: Meta description
checks.description: Every page should have a `<meta name="description">` tag

checks.name: Favicon link
checks.description: Every page should link to the site favicon

checks.name: Stylesheet link
checks.description: Every page must link to `styles.css`

checks.name: App script with defer
checks.description: Every page must include `app.js` with the `defer` attribute

checks.name: Skip-to-content link
checks.description: Accessibility requirement: skip-link for keyboard users

checks.name: Header element
checks.description: Every page must have a `<header>` with site navigation

checks.name: Main content
checks.description: Every page must have `<main id="main-content">`

checks.name: Footer element
checks.description: Every page must have a `<footer>` section

checks.name: Back-to-top button
checks.description: Every page should have the back-to-top bar

checks.name: ADL panel
checks.description: Every page should include the Accessibility Dashboard panel

checks.name: Badge lightbox
checks.description: Every page should include the badge lightbox component

checks.name: SEO meta block
checks.description: Every page must have `<!-- SEO Meta -->` marker (from seo_inject.py)

checks.name: Canonical URL
checks.description: Every page must have a `<link rel="canonical">` tag

checks.name: Open Graph tags
checks.description: Every page must have og:title, og:description, og:image, and og:url

checks.name: JSON-LD structured data
checks.description: Every page must have `application/ld+json` schema markup

checks.name: Twitter/X card
checks.description: Every page should have a twitter:card meta tag

checks.name: Discover navigation menu
checks.description: Every page must have the Discover category menu (mega-menu--categories)

checks.name: Resources menu
checks.description: Every page must have the Resources quick-links menu (mega-menu-quick-links)

checks.name: Breadcrumb navigation
checks.description: All interior pages (not root index.html) must have breadcrumb navigation for wayfinding

checks.name: Ethics ticker (app.js)
checks.description: app.js must contain the ethics-ticker IIFE that creates the ticker DOM

checks.name: Ethics ticker (styles.css)
checks.description: styles.css must contain .ethics-ticker style rules

checks.name: Policy links in footer
checks.description: Footer must link to all active policy pages

checks.name: Tool links in footer
checks.description: Footer must link to all active AI Readiness Tools

categories.name: Link Integrity
categories.description: Link integrity — resolves every internal href/src path and verifies external `<a>` tag URLs are reachable with human oversight.
categories.why: Broken links degrade user trust and SEO ranking. Internal dead links indicate deleted or renamed files that weren't updated site-wide. External dead links point users to unavailable resources. Google Search Console penalizes sites with excessive 404 responses. This category ensures every link on every page resolves to a real destination.

checks.name: Internal link resolution
checks.description: Resolves each `href`/`src` relative to the file's directory depth and checks if the target file exists. Directory links resolved to index.html.

checks.name: External URL reachability
checks.description: HTTP HEAD/GET check for each unique external URL in `<a>` tags only (multi-line safe regex). Unverified links = ERROR. Skip with `--skip-urls`.

checks.name: Bot-blocked domain verification
checks.description: Bot-blocked domains that cannot be HTTP-checked require screenshot proof in assets/Citation images/ registered in Audit/verified-items.json. Verified links get INFO; unverified links get ERROR.

checks.name: Special URI skipping
checks.description: Skips `#`, `mailto:`, `tel:`, `javascript:`, and `data:` URIs — not checkable links.

categories.name: Content Readiness
categories.description: Content readiness — detects placeholder content and outdated dates with multi-line comment awareness.
categories.why: Placeholder text ('TODO', 'coming soon', 'lorem ipsum', 'WIP', 'HACK') in production signals incomplete work and damages credibility. Outdated date references outside of known historical contexts may mislead users about data currency. This category enforces content readiness standards. (Orphan file detection is handled by the Structural category to avoid duplication.)

checks.name: Placeholder content
checks.description: Detects 'coming soon', 'TODO', 'TBD', 'FIXME', 'lorem ipsum', 'WIP', 'HACK', 'XXX', 'TEMP', and bare 'placeholder' in visible text. Skips multi-line HTML comments.

checks.name: Outdated dates
checks.description: Flags years 2000–2023 in content (context-aware: exempts historical keywords, academic citations, date-safe components, and educational examples — no directory-level exemptions). Skips multi-line HTML comments.

categories.name: Content Consistency
categories.description: Content consistency — validates page structure, component integrity, counters, search index, and glossary synchronization across all pages.
categories.why: Stale counters and broken component structures undermine user trust in a site that teaches AI accuracy. Glossary desynchronization between the manifest and displayed counts creates visible contradictions. Missing template sections on framework pages break the consistent learning experience. An empty or malformed search index makes site search non-functional. This category ensures what users see matches what actually exists.

checks.name: HTML file count
checks.description: Reports total HTML files discovered in the site

checks.name: Glossary manifest integrity
checks.description: Verifies `manifest.json` totalTerms matches the sum of all per-letter shard counts

checks.name: Shard count verification
checks.description: Checks each letter shard's actual term count against the manifest's declared count

checks.name: Search index validation
checks.description: Validates `search-index.json` exists, is a non-empty JSON array, and every entry has title + url fields

checks.name: Homepage counter values
checks.description: Validates `data-counter` attributes on index.html against actual tool count, glossary terms, AND framework page count

checks.name: Glossary page count sync
checks.description: Verifies the glossary term count appears consistently across `pages/glossary.html` (3+ locations)

checks.name: Comparison panel structure
checks.description: Every comparison-panel must contain a comparison-panel__divider element

checks.name: Deprecated component classes
checks.description: Flags old feature-list--check/--cross format (skips HTML comments) — should use feature-list__item--positive/--neutral cards

checks.name: Framework template completeness
checks.description: Learn pages must have required sections: hero, concept, how-it-works, comparison, examples, when-to-use, use-cases, related, CTA

checks.name: Footer tool count consistency
checks.description: Footer AI Readiness section tool count must match discovered active tools on every page (div-depth-aware section parsing)

categories.name: Bias/Inclusivity
categories.description: Content quality — loads terms from `bias-terms.json` and scans visible text only (HTML tags stripped) for bias, profanity, and slurs.
categories.why: An AI education site must model the inclusive communication standards it teaches. We maintain this term list not because these words are inherently wrong, but because language shapes perception. As a site with a neurodivergent audience, Praxis has a responsibility to surface terms that major industry style guides (Google, Microsoft, Apple, APA) have identified as carrying exclusionary, gendered, or ableist connotations. Profanity and slurs have zero tolerance on an educational site. The audit flags bias terms for human review (INFO) and profanity/slurs as best-practice violations (WARNING).

checks.name: Exclusionary framing
checks.description: Detects condescending or audience-excluding phrasing

checks.name: Gendered language
checks.description: Flags gendered terms — suggests gender-neutral alternatives

checks.name: Tech exclusionary terms
checks.description: Flags legacy tech terms with exclusionary origins

checks.name: Ableist language
checks.description: Catches disability-metaphor terms — suggests neutral alternatives

checks.name: Profanity
checks.description: Catches profanity and informal abbreviations (wtf, stfu, etc.)

checks.name: Slurs
checks.description: Zero-tolerance detection of racial, homophobic, and ableist slurs

categories.name: Accessibility
categories.description: WCAG AA compliance — checks language declarations, image alt text, heading hierarchy, link clarity, form labels, and tab order.
categories.why: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 Level AA compliance is both a legal requirement (ADA, Section 508) and a core site value. Missing `lang` attributes prevent screen readers from selecting the correct speech synthesizer. Missing `alt` attributes make images invisible to blind users. Skipped heading levels break document outline navigation. Vague link text ('click here') is meaningless to screen reader users who navigate by link list. Unlabelled form inputs are unusable without sight. Positive tabindex values create unpredictable tab order. This category verifies foundational accessibility requirements.

checks.name: HTML lang attribute
checks.description: Every page must declare a language on `<html>`

checks.name: Image alt attributes
checks.description: Every `` must have an `alt` attribute. Multi-line safe (full-text regex with re.DOTALL). Empty alt for decorative images noted as INFO.

checks.name: Heading hierarchy
checks.description: Headings must not skip levels (e.g., h1 → h3 without h2); nav/footer headings excluded from hierarchy checks

checks.name: h1 presence
checks.description: Every page must have exactly one `<h1>` element for accessibility and SEO

checks.name: Vague link text
checks.description: Links must have descriptive text — flags 'click here', 'read more', 'learn more', bare 'here'/'link'

checks.name: Form label association
checks.description: Every `<input>`, `<select>`, and `<textarea>` must have an associated `<label for>`, `aria-label`/`aria-labelledby`, or be wrapped in a `<label>`. Skips hidden/submit/button/reset/image types.

checks.name: Positive tabindex
checks.description: Flags `tabindex` values > 0 — overrides natural DOM tab order and creates unpredictable navigation

categories.name: Source Verification
categories.description: Source verification — counts .gov/.edu citations, verifies sources with human oversight, and enforces the 2024+ freshness policy.
categories.why: An AI education site must cite authoritative, current sources. The project's sourcing policy requires .gov and .edu domains only (except benchmark pages). Citations older than 2024 are ERROR-level violations because AI research evolves rapidly and outdated data misleads users. Every statistic displayed in highlight boxes or stat cards must have visible source attribution. Citation tracking (`data-added` attributes) enables ongoing freshness auditing. This category enforces the full sourcing standards defined in `.claude/sourcingstandards.md`.

checks.name: .gov/.edu citation status
checks.description: Reports per-page .gov/.edu link count with verification status (verified by default, skip with --skip-urls)

checks.name: Highlight box attribution
checks.description: Content-page highlight boxes with specific stats (%, $, numeric billion/million) must have a `highlight-box__source` element. Skips learn/ (no-citations rule) and tools/ (example content). Skips historical-context (--warning) boxes.

checks.name: Stat card attribution
checks.description: Research stat cards must have a `research-stat-card__source` element

checks.name: Citation freshness (STRICT)
checks.description: All external citations on ALL pages must be from 2024 or later. Multi-line safe (full-text regex). Detects dates in URL paths, stripped anchor text, and nearby highlight-box__source context. No directory skips — every page is scanned.

checks.name: Citation timestamp tracking
checks.description: External links on citation pages must have `data-added="YYYY-MM-DD"` within the `<a>` tag itself (tag-scoped, not line-scoped).

checks.name: Citation URL reachability
checks.description: HTTP HEAD/GET check for each .gov/.edu URL. Bot-blocked domains require screenshot proof in assets/Citation images/ — verified get INFO, unverified get ERROR. Skip HTTP checks with `--skip-urls`.

categories.name: Data Integrity
categories.description: Data integrity — validates JSON files, chart values, anchor targets, glossary fields, search index entries, and count synchronization.
categories.why: Corrupted JSON crashes the glossary, search, and chart systems at runtime. Mismatched gauge chart values display contradictory numbers. Broken anchor targets (#id links pointing to nonexistent elements) frustrate users. Missing glossary fields cause JavaScript errors during rendering. Invalid search index entries send users to 404 pages. This category ensures all structured data is parseable, internally consistent, and correctly linked.

checks.name: Bar chart data-width range
checks.description: Validates `data-width` values are 0–100 (valid percentage range)

checks.name: Gauge chart value matching
checks.description: Positional: each gauge-circle's `data-value` must match the `gauge-value` text inside its own `<div>` block (multi-line safe)

checks.name: Glossary count synchronization
checks.description: Checks glossary term count appears consistently in both `index.html` (2+) and `pages/glossary.html` (3+)

checks.name: JSON data file integrity
checks.description: All .json files in data/ must parse without error

checks.name: Same-page anchor targets
checks.description: Fragment-only links (href="#id") must have a matching id attribute on the same page

checks.name: Glossary shard field validation
checks.description: Each glossary term must have required fields: term, definition

checks.name: Search index entry validation
checks.description: Each search-index.json entry must have title and url fields, and url must resolve to an existing file

errors.message: Source Verification failed with 164 error(s) — Data Integrity cannot pass when source integrity is compromised
errors.suggestion: Resolve all Source Verification errors first

categories.name: Site Architecture
categories.description: Site architecture — detects orphan files, duplicate IDs, meta description quality, deactivated tool links, sitemap coverage, and title tag quality.
categories.why: Orphan pages are invisible to users and waste hosting resources. Duplicate HTML IDs cause unpredictable behavior in JavaScript and assistive technology. Short meta descriptions reduce click-through rates in search results. Links to deactivated tools send users to dead pages. Missing sitemap entries prevent search engine indexing. Poor title tags hurt both SEO ranking and browser tab readability. This category validates the structural integrity of the site as a whole.

checks.name: Orphan file detection
checks.description: Identifies HTML files not linked from any other page (resolves directory links to index.html, excludes fragments)

checks.name: Duplicate ID detection
checks.description: Finds multiple elements with the same `id` attribute within a single page

checks.name: Meta description quality
checks.description: Flags meta descriptions shorter than 50 characters

checks.name: Title tag quality
checks.description: Verifies every page has a `<title>` tag with appropriate length (30-65 chars optimal)

checks.name: Sitemap coverage
checks.description: Verifies every non-fragment HTML page is listed in `sitemap.xml`

checks.name: Deactivated tool links
checks.description: Ensures active pages don't link to deactivated tools

checks.name: Fragment file reporting
checks.description: Identifies files without DOCTYPE/html (partial templates, not full pages)

checks.name: Deactivated tool tracking
checks.description: Reports tool files that exist but are not linked from the footer

categories.name: Documentation
categories.description: Documentation freshness — validates .claude/ docs exist, cross-references claimed counts against filesystem, and detects stale session references.
categories.why: Project documentation that contradicts the actual codebase causes confusion during development. Missing critical docs (HANDOFF.md, sourcing standards) break the project's session continuity model. Stale session references indicate documents that haven't been reviewed recently, increasing the risk of acting on outdated information. This category treats documentation as auditable infrastructure, not optional artifacts.

checks.name: Required docs exist
checks.description: Verifies critical project docs (HANDOFF.md, sourcingstandards.md, SiteFrameworks.md, FrameworkOverhaul.md) exist in .claude/

checks.name: HANDOFF.md count accuracy
checks.description: Cross-references HTML file count, glossary terms, interactive tools, and technique counts (total/text/modality) against filesystem

checks.name: SiteFrameworks.md count accuracy
checks.description: Cross-references CSS/JS line counts and total HTML count against actual files

checks.name: MASTER-INVENTORY.md count accuracy
checks.description: Cross-references HTML file count and glossary term count against actual filesystem

checks.name: Stale session references
checks.description: Flags docs whose latest session reference is more than 5 sessions behind the most recent

infos.message: No session references found in document (Citation and sourcing rules)
